title: 4 Top Stock Trades for Wednesday: NIO, AMD, FB, DASH
text: Nio, Advanced Micro Devices, Facebook and DoorDash were our top stock trades for Wednesday. Let's look at the charts.

title: U.S. FTC's antitrust case against Facebook gets new judge
text: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission's antitrust lawsuit against Facebook was transferred to another judge on Tuesday so that it and a similar case filed by state attorneys general will be heard by the same person, according to a court filing on Tuesday.

title: Big Tech News: Why TWTR, FB and AMZN Stock Are Slumping
text: Facebook, Twitter and AMZN stock are all slumping this week after moving to de-platform Trump. Here's what you should know now.

title: 5 Computer Stocks to Buy That Aren't Apple or Microsoft
text: These five computer stocks are reasonably valued, offer five-year EPS growth of more than 5% and pay a solid dividend to boot. The post 5 Computer Stocks to Buy That Aren't Apple or Microsoft appeared first on InvestorPlace.

title: Facebook: Why It's Time to Buy the Scapegoat
text: Facebook stock is a buy because the company doesn't care about the content of what passes through its cloud data centers, only that the data flows so it can be monetized. The post Facebook: Why It's Time to Buy the Scapegoat appeared first on InvestorPlace.

title: Even After Wearing My Lawyer's Hat, I Find Facebook Undervalued
text: Even After Wearing My Lawyer's Hat, I Find Facebook Undervalued

title: Facebook, GM among brands to help fund Ad Council vaccine campaign
text: The Ad Council on Tuesday said it has raised $37 million from corporate donors including Bank of America, Facebook and General Motors to fund a nationwide coronavirus vaccine campaign aimed at encouraging Americans to get vaccinated.

title: Why an Antitrust Break-Up Could Be Good for Facebook's Stock
text: Facebook could be worth more in separate pieces than together as one company.

title: Instagram boss Adam Mosseri defends Facebook's values: 'No platform is neutral' (FB)
text: Instagram boss Adam Mosseri is defending his platform in the wake of the riots at the US Capitol last week. Mosseri on Monday tweeted about Instagram's values in response to a tweet from OneZero reporter Will Oremus, who posted about Facebook's hiring this week of Roy Austin, the company's first vice president of Civil Rights. Oremus tweeted that Facebook could have hired for the position more than five years ago "if it hadn't been so intent at the time on portraying itself as a neutral platform and promoting online connection as an absolute good."

title: What We Learned About Facebook in 2020
text: The social media powerhouse remains at the top of its game.

title: Need to Know: Trump's about to leave DC. That's bad news for these stocks, strategist says
text: We're going to be watching less news and digital media and getting out more in the coming years, says our call of the day. It's time to ditch those stocks.

title: Facebook has hired its first vice president of civil rights (FB)
text: Facebook has hired its first-ever vice president of civil rights, the company announced on Monday. The appointment makes good on a promise Facebook made in July last year, when it announced it would be hiring a civil rights lead. Austin's title is vice president of civil rights and deputy general counsel.

title: Signal and Telegram downloads surge after WhatsApp says it will share data with Facebook
text: WhatsApp updated its terms of service agreement that appears to give users little choice to opt out of sharing data with parent company Facebook.
